definitions.text:
1. To make narrow.In narrow circuit, straitend by foe.
2. To contract; to confine; as, to straiten the British commerce.
3. To make tense or tight; as, to straiten cord.
4. To distress; to perplex; to press with poverty or other necessity; as, man straitened in his circumstances.
5. To press by want of sufficient room.Waters when straitened, as at the falls of bridges, give roaring noise.
